"I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious." -Albert Einstein
"Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly." -John F. Kennedy
"It's supposed to be automatic, but actually you have to push this button. " -John Brunner
"If freedom is short of weapons, we must compensate with willpower." -Adolf Hitler
"Don't explain computers to laymen. Simpler to explain sex to a virgin." -Robert A. Heinlein
"I have not failed. I’ve just found 10,000 ways that won’t work." -Thomas Edison
"The technology you use impresses no one. The experience you create with it is everything." -Sean Gerety
"Technology is a useful servant but a dangerous master." -Christian Lous Lange
"The past changes a little every time we retell it." -Hilary Mantel
"History is written by the victors." -Winston Churchill
"If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way." -Napoleon Hill
"It does not matter how slowly you go, as long as you do not stop." -Confusious
"Never try and teach a pig to sing. It wastes your time and annoys the pig." -Lazarus Long
"It's a business. If I could make more money down in the zinc mines I'd be mining zinc." -Rodger Maris
"A goal without a plan is a dream." -Elbert Hubbard
"The golden age never was the present age." -Benjamin Franklin
"Chance makes a plaything of a man's life." -Lucius Annaeus Seneca
"There are no dumb questionsonly dumb answers." -Marshall Loeb
"Trust everybody, but cut the cards yourself." -W. C. Fields
"Trust, but verify." -Russian Proverb
"He who doesn’t take risks doesn’t drink champagne." -Russian Proverb
